title: OK/okay/ok
alt: After changing it back and forth several times and consulting with internet linguist Gretchen McCulloch, I settled on "ok" in my book How To, but I'm still on the fence. Maybe I should just switch to "oK."
transcript:
[Four different ways to write the word "okay" are presented with a caption below each version.]
okay 
Normal ok
Normal OK 
Kind of old O.K.
Like an alien impersonating a human[Caption below the panel:]
How your spelling of "okay" makes you sound
